segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, and the woman is completely ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is already soaked, and she’s just standing there drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to slip any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she hasn’t even noticed them either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to look up from that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is getting closer to the kids, and she’s still not reacting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious she is to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is turning into a swamp, and she’s just polishing silverware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone comes in and turns off that faucet before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away, but I also can’t believe how unaware she is.
segments.speaker: PAR
